0.title: Account Memberships
0.description: Account Memberships model and related endpoints

1.title: Model
1.description: A Member contains extended information about a user's access to an account.

3.title: Add Member <Badge type="experimental"/>
3.description: This endpoint allows you to add or update the membership of a user to an account.

5.title: List members
5.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the list memberships to an account.

7.title: Revoke Member
7.description: This endpoint allows you to revoke a users membership to an account.

9.title: Errors
9.description:
| Status |           Code           |                          Description                           |
| :----- | :----------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | LAST_OWNER_NOT_REVOKABLE | The last remaining membership to an account cannot be revoked. |

10.title: List Account Memberships for Authenticated Subject
10.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the accounts that the authenticated subject is a member of.

12.title: List Account Memberships for a User
12.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the accounts that a user is a member of.

19.title: Create an Account
19.description: This endpoint allows you to create an Account.

21.title: Get an Account
21.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve an Account.

23.title: Update an Account
23.description: This endpoint allows you to update an account.

25.title: Update Subscriptions
25.description: This endpoint allows you to update the subscriptions on an account.

26.title: Attributes
26.description:
| Status |         Code         |                    Description                     |
| :----- | :------------------- | :------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | INVALID_ACCOUNT_ID   | The account does not exist.                        |
| 403    | INVALID_SUBSCRIPTION | One of the subscriptions in the list is not valid. |

27.title: Errors
27.description:
| Status |         Code         |                    Description                     |
| :----- | :------------------- | :------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | INVALID_ACCOUNT_ID   | The account does not exist.                        |
| 403    | INVALID_SUBSCRIPTION | One of the subscriptions in the list is not valid. |

31.title: Create an API Key
31.description: This endpoint allows you to create an API key.

33.title: List API Keys
33.description: This endpoint allows you to list all API Keys for an Account.

35.title: Update an API Key
35.description: This endpoint allows you to enable or disable an API key.

38.title: Authenticating API Calls
38.description:
API calls can be authenticated by either providing an API key in the
"X-Api-Key" header or by providing a user access token in the "Authorization"
header.

39.title: API Keys
39.description: API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

40.title: User Access Tokens
40.description:
User access tokens provide time-limited access to all Centrapay accounts for
which the user is a member. Access tokens are issued using OIDC code flow via
the Centrapay OAuth authorization server and login page at auth.centrapay.com.

41.title: Claims
41.description:
The following table lists the claims which may be be included in a user id token.
At minimum, the "sub" claim and one of "phone_number" or "email" will be present.

42.title: Roles and Permissions
42.description:
Users and API keys are assigned a role for their associated Centrapay
account(s). The permissions granted to the roles are shown in the table below.

43.title: Account Flags
43.description:
Some permissions require an additional flag associated to their individual account or the
targeted account that owns the resource (they may be the same account). For each permission,
if there is a flag associated to it then at least one of them must be met.

45.title: Bank Account Connection Intents
45.description: Bank Account Connection Intent model and related endpoints

46.title: Model
46.description:
|      Name       |                                                                                               description                                                                                                |
| :-------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| quartz-accounts | Initiates an authorization flow for authorizing access to bank account details. After a Bank Account Connection Intent has been authorized, one or more Centrapay Bank Account resources may be created. |
| quartz-payment  | Initiates an authorization flow for authorizing access to create payments.                                                                                                                               |

47.title: Bank Account Connection Intent Types
47.description:
|      Name       |                                                                                               description                                                                                                |
| :-------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| quartz-accounts | Initiates an authorization flow for authorizing access to bank account details. After a Bank Account Connection Intent has been authorized, one or more Centrapay Bank Account resources may be created. |
| quartz-payment  | Initiates an authorization flow for authorizing access to create payments.                                                                                                                               |

48.title: Create Bank Account Connection Intent <Badge type="experimental"/>
48.description: This endpoint allows you to create a Bank Account Connection Intent.

51.title: Authorize Bank Account Connection Intent <Badge type="experimental"/>
51.description: This endpoint allows you to authorize a Bank Account Connection Intent.

53.title: Bank Accounts
53.description: Bank Account model and related endpoints

54.title: Bank Account Model
54.description: Types of bank accounts to allow access to different Asset Types.

55.title: Attributes
55.description: Types of bank accounts to allow access to different Asset Types.

56.title: Bank Account Type <Badge type="experimental"/>
56.description: Types of bank accounts to allow access to different Asset Types.

57.title: Bank Account Approval Type Summary Model <Badge type="experimental"/>
57.description:
A summary of the Bank Account Approvals for a Bank Account.
There is one object per type of Bank Account Approval, which provides a summary of the approval status.

58.title: Attributes
58.description: The Bank Account balance, retrieved using Open Banking flows. The supported Bank Account type is quartz.

59.title: Bank Account Balance Model <Badge type="experimental"/>
59.description: The Bank Account balance, retrieved using Open Banking flows. The supported Bank Account type is quartz.

61.title: Create Bank Account
61.description:
A Bank Account can be created with or without direct debit authorized.  By including
directDebitAuthority, the user accepts our Direct Debit terms
and has authority to operate this account.

62.title: Attributes
62.description:
| Status |                Code                |                                           Description                                            |
| :----- | :--------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED        | The Centrapay account already has the max amount of directDebitAuthorized enabled Bank Accounts. |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_HOLDER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED | The global maximum Bank Accounts for the provided Bank Account number has been reached.          |
| 403    | DUPLICATE_BANK_ACCOUNT             | The Centrapay account already holds this Bank Account.                                           |

63.title: Errors
63.description:
| Status |                Code                |                                           Description                                            |
| :----- | :--------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED        | The Centrapay account already has the max amount of directDebitAuthorized enabled Bank Accounts. |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_HOLDER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED | The global maximum Bank Accounts for the provided Bank Account number has been reached.          |
| 403    | DUPLICATE_BANK_ACCOUNT             | The Centrapay account already holds this Bank Account.                                           |

64.title: Add Direct Debit Authority to a Bank Account
64.description: By using this endpoint, the user accepts our Direct Debit terms and has authority to operate this account.

65.title: Attributes
65.description:
| Status |              Code               |                                           Description                                            |
| :----- | :------------------------------ | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | DIRECT_DEBIT_ALREADY_AUTHORIZED | This bank authority cannot be changed as all fields have been set.                               |
| 403    | DIRECT_DEBIT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED     | The Centrapay account already has the max amount of directDebitAuthorized enabled Bank Accounts. |

66.title: Errors
66.description:
| Status |              Code               |                                           Description                                            |
| :----- | :------------------------------ | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 403    | DIRECT_DEBIT_ALREADY_AUTHORIZED | This bank authority cannot be changed as all fields have been set.                               |
| 403    | DIRECT_DEBIT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED     | The Centrapay account already has the max amount of directDebitAuthorized enabled Bank Accounts. |

67.title: Get Bank Account
67.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve information about a Bank Account.

69.title: Get Bank Account Balance <Badge type="experimental"/>
69.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the balance of a Bank Account.

71.title: Errors
71.description:
| Status |            Code            |                                         Description                                         |
| :----- | :------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| 403    | BANK_BALANCE_NOT_SUPPORTED | The [Bank Account Type][] does not support retrieval of a balance using Open Banking flows. |
| 403    | BANK_AUTHORIZATION_INVALID | The access token to retrieve the [Bank Account Balance][] is no longer valid.               |

72.title: Verify Bank Account
72.description: Verification codes show up on statements when a user makes withdrawals and deposits. To verify an account, you need to direct the user to make a Top Up or Withdrawal and then check their statement.

73.title: Attributes
73.description:
| Status |                    Code                     |                                   Description                                   |
| :----- | :------------------------------------------ | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_VERIFIED               | The bank account is already verified.                                           |
| 403    | VERIFICATION_CODE_INVALID                   | The verification code is incorrect.                                             |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_VERIFICATION_ATTEMPTS_EXCEEDED | The bank account's maximum failed verification attempts has been reached.       |
| 403    | ACCOUNT_MISMATCH                            | The top up / withdrawal and the bank account do not belong to the same account. |

74.title: Errors
74.description:
| Status |                    Code                     |                                   Description                                   |
| :----- | :------------------------------------------ | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_VERIFIED               | The bank account is already verified.                                           |
| 403    | VERIFICATION_CODE_INVALID                   | The verification code is incorrect.                                             |
| 403    | BANK_ACCOUNT_VERIFICATION_ATTEMPTS_EXCEEDED | The bank account's maximum failed verification attempts has been reached.       |
| 403    | ACCOUNT_MISMATCH                            | The top up / withdrawal and the bank account do not belong to the same account. |

89.title: Business Model
89.description:
|    Status    |                                                                 Description                                                                 |                                   Allowed Reasons                                   |
| :----------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies businesses that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                     |
| provisioning | Identifies businesses that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                     |
| active       | Identifies businesses that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                     |
| deactivated  | Identifies businesses that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | data-quality-issues,change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued, duplicate, blocked |
| on-hold      | Identifies businesses that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure,  no-response                                             |

90.title: Attributes
90.description:
|    Status    |                                                                 Description                                                                 |                                   Allowed Reasons                                   |
| :----------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies businesses that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                     |
| provisioning | Identifies businesses that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                     |
| active       | Identifies businesses that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                     |
| deactivated  | Identifies businesses that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | data-quality-issues,change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued, duplicate, blocked |
| on-hold      | Identifies businesses that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure,  no-response                                             |

91.title: Onboarding Statuses
91.description:
|    Status    |                                                                 Description                                                                 |                                   Allowed Reasons                                   |
| :----------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies businesses that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                     |
| provisioning | Identifies businesses that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                     |
| active       | Identifies businesses that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                     |
| deactivated  | Identifies businesses that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | data-quality-issues,change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued, duplicate, blocked |
| on-hold      | Identifies businesses that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure,  no-response                                             |

92.title: Onboarding Status Reasons
92.description:
|          Reason           |                           Description                            |
| :------------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
| duplicate                 | The business already exists in the Centrapay system.             |
| data-quality-issues       | Data quality issues are preventing the business from onboarding. |
| no-response               | No response has been received from the business.                 |
| change-of-ownership       | The business has changed ownership.                              |
| centrapay-discontinued    | The business is no longer using Centrapay.                       |
| seasonal-business-closure | The business has closed temporarily.                             |

101.title: Get Business by Account Id <Badge type="experimental"/>
101.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a Business by account id.

103.title: Search NZ Company Register <Badge type="experimental"/>
103.description: This endpoint returns a list of companies that match the queried param on company name, nzbn number or company number. Results are paginated and ordered by relevance.

105.title: Get Business Details from NZ Company Register <Badge type="experimental"/>
105.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a Business by account id.

107.title: Set Business Onboarding Status
107.description: This endpoint returns allows you to set the onboarding status of a Business.

110.title: Timestamp
110.description:
A point in time, usually with millisecond precision, represented as an
ISO 8601 date string (eg "2021-06-11T02:51:11.000Z"). Timestamps
are in the UTC timezone as denoted by the "Z" suffix.

111.title: BigNumber
111.description:
A number, represented as a String, which can have arbitrary size or precision.
Most Centrapay APIs that deal with transactable value (ie. assets, payments,
etc) represent the value as BigNumbers. Depending on the context, a BigNumber
may be used to represent an integer or a decimal amount.

112.title: Monetary
112.description:
A monetary amount in a currency, represented as an Object. The amount is
usually an integer in the smallest denomination for the currency (ie cents) but
may be a decimal value for some currencies (eg Bitcoin). The currency is
typically represented as an ISO 4217 code.

113.title: Fields
113.description:
|   Name   |          Type           |                        Description                         |
| -------- | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| amount   | BigNumber | Value in the currency's smallest denomination (eg. cents). |
| currency | String                  | Currency code (eg. "NZD").                                 |

114.title: CRN
114.description:
A Centrapay Resource Name (CRN) is a colon-delimited String that uniquely
identifies any Centrapay resource.

115.title: Location
115.description:
A location's represented as an Object with properties to denote the location both absolute and
by locality.

116.title: Required Fields
116.description:
|  Name   |  Type  |                                      Description                                       |
| ------- | ------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| street  | String | Unit, number, and name of street address.                                              |
| city    | String | City of location.                                                                      |
| country | String | ISO 3166 Country code. (eg. "NZ"). |

117.title: Optional Fields
117.description:
|   Name   |  Type  |                                                  Description                                                  |
| -------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| lat      | Number | Absolute latitude coordinate. If you don't provide this, we will automatically infer this from your address.  |
| lng      | Number | Absolute longitude coordinate. If you don't provide this, we will automatically infer this from your address. |
| suburb   | String | Suburb of location.                                                                                           |
| postCode | String | Post or Zip code of location.                                                                                 |
| state    | String | The state or region of the location (eg. "Auckland").                                                         |

118.title: PhoneNumber
118.description: A phone number, represented in E.123 international notation (eg "+6421537663"). We usually use this for receiving text messages.

120.title: 200 Ok
120.description: Everything's ok. Enjoy your well formed response!

121.title: 400 Malformed Request
121.description:
This is a syntax failure. When you get these back, your application needs to change the way it
behaves in order to get back the resource that you're after.

122.title: Debugging
122.description: API key or JWT is missing, expired or invalid. Go look at our Auth documentation.

123.title: 401 Unauthorized
123.description: API key or JWT is missing, expired or invalid. Go look at our Auth documentation.

124.title: 403 Forbidden
124.description:
A 403 status indicates resource missing, permission denied or
business rule violation.

125.title: Resource missing or permission denied
125.description:
When the resource exists and access is authorized but some other business rule
is violated then a 403 is returned. Additional information will be included in
the "message" field of the response body. The possible values for the "message"
field will be documented on each endpoint.

126.title: Business rule violated
126.description:
When the resource exists and access is authorized but some other business rule
is violated then a 403 is returned. Additional information will be included in
the "message" field of the response body. The possible values for the "message"
field will be documented on each endpoint.

127.title: 404 Route Not Found
127.description:
Variant on a 400, there's a bug in your code that means you've got a typo in
the URL or HTTP method. Please check against examples in our documentation.

128.title: 429 Too Many Requests
128.description: Centrapay API rate limits have been exceeded.

129.title: Debugging
129.description:
If you get a 500 level error, something has gone wrong on our end. Retrying
should solve the issue. Usually a Centrapay Engineer will investigate but
bug reports are also welcome at integrations@centrapay.com.

130.title: 5xx Server Error
130.description:
If you get a 500 level error, something has gone wrong on our end. Retrying
should solve the issue. Usually a Centrapay Engineer will investigate but
bug reports are also welcome at integrations@centrapay.com.

135.title: Create a presigned URL for Media Upload <Badge type="experimental"/>
135.description: This endpoint allows you to upload a media file to Centrapay. It returns a presigned URL that can be used to download the media file.

137.title: Get Media Upload Location <Badge type="experimental"/>
137.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the upload location of a media file.

144.title: Farmlands Connection
144.description: Farmlands has partnered with Centrapay to deliver new ways for your business to authorise and process Farmlands Card payments that are faster, easier, and more secure than ever.

146.title: Creating Digital Tokens
146.description: Create custom assets that can be exchanged for products or deals.

147.title: Token Collection
147.description: A collection is a grouping of tokens that share the same attributes and redemption conditions, e.g.

148.title: Redemption Conditions
148.description:
A redemption condition allows a Merchant to accept tokens from a token collection.
It contains redemption details specific to that merchant, e.g. redeemable product SKUs.

150.title: Creating Test Money
150.description: Use test assets to make testing integrations easier.

151.title: Via API
151.description: To create test dollars via the Centrapay API:

152.title: Via Centrapay App
152.description: To create test dollars via the Centrapay app:

153.title: eCommerce
153.description: How to redirect users back to an e-commerce website after paying/cancelling a Centrapay Payment Request.

154.title: Example OIDC Consumer
154.description: How to integrate a browser-based application with the Centrapay OAuth server using an OIDC flow.oidc-client-js) JavaScript library.

156.title: Trigger Token Refresh
156.description: Manually trigger a token refresh when expired due to user being offline.

157.title: OIDC Client Logout

158.title: Farmlands Card Partner Support Guide
158.description: How to for Farmlands Card Partners and Card Holders to request support from the relevant company and teams to get the help they need.

159.title: Support for Portal Users
159.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

160.title: Trouble Shooting
160.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

161.title: Support for POS Integrators
161.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

162.title: SLA Support Level
162.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

163.title: P1 - Severe Business Disruption
163.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

165.title: P3 - Minor Business Disruption
165.description: Centrapay Platform is operational but suffering performance degradation

166.title: P4 - Adhoc requests as requested by Farmlands
166.description: Adhoc requests as requested by Farmlands

167.title: Farmlands Portal Guide
167.description: Farmlands Co-operative (Farmands) have partnered with Centrapay Payment Gateway (Centrapay) to deliver a secure web portal for Farmlands Card payments.

168.title: Getting Started
168.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

169.title: Business Information
169.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

170.title: Registration
170.description: Once the Business and Merchants are set up in the Centrapay Portal, users will receive an email from Farmlands inviting them to register for the portal. Users must use the email address provided in the initial setup process to register.

171.title: Log In
171.description: The Centrapay Business Portal will store your authenticated session for up to 60 days. During this time, it is not necessary to re-authenticate simply enter your email address to log in. After 60 days, you will be prompted to re-authenticate by entering a Verification Code sent to your registered email address.

172.title: Dashboard
172.description: The Dashboard is an overview of Centrapay Business Account and will be your main screen for generating an authorisation or releasing a previous Farmlands Authorisation.

173.title: Farmlands Authorisations
173.description: The Centrapay Business Portal provides a real-time authorisation of a Farmlands Card when presented as payment for the purchase of goods or services. It validates that the Card is active and there is a sufficient available balance to process the transaction.

174.title: Authorisation Responses
174.description:
|          Type          |                                                                                                        Description                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Authorisation Approved | Funds have now been placed on hold onto the customer account, pending the receipt of the Card Partner’s invoice within the agreed period.                                                                                  |
| Pending                | Card Partner creates the request, but the authorisation is not yet complete. This authorisation is not approved.                                                                                                           |
| Check ID               | This response may occur for a high-value sale. This means the transaction is pending authorisation until the Card Partner confirms they have authenticated the customer’s photo ID against the name on the Farmlands Card. |
| Declined               | The authorisation is declined due to an invalid card number, a credit limit exceeded, or Card Partner is unable to verify a high-value transaction. Refer to Farmlands Contact Centre 0800 200 600                         |
| Release                | The funds “on hold” are cancelled by Card Partner. This may occur when a Card Partner is unable to fulfil an order. (This is not used for a refund).                                                                       |

175.title: Create a Farmlands Authorisation
175.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands.co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

176.title: Invoicing & Settlement
176.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands.co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

177.title: Releasing Funds
177.description: The Authorised funds will be held against the Cardholder account for 31 days or until the invoice is received.  If the order is cancelled before the invoice is submitted to Farmlands the Authorisation should be released to remove the hold on Cardholder funds.

178.title: Release Hold on Customer Funds
178.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

179.title: Authorisation History
179.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

180.title: Setting a Default Merchant
180.description: Select your Default Merchant (First-time user) - The default merchant is the branch or outlet that the user normally works from, and which the transaction will be associated with.

181.title: Manage My Centrapay Business Account
181.description: The Account Owner has access to additional options to manage their Centrapay Business Account, including adding an removing users who have access to complete authorisations on their account.

182.title: Merchants
182.description: This area relates to the management of new and existing Branches/Locations used for Centrapay’s other payment types e.g gift cards (i.e not Farmlands). Additional merchants added through the Merchants area will not be able to accept Farmlands Card until they are setup by Farmlands.

183.title: Bank Accounts
183.description: This function is only available to businesses who wish to use other Centrapay supported payment methods other than Farmlands Cards. (e.g. Gift Cards or NZD).

184.title: Members
184.description: On the Members page you can manage the members connected to the Centrapay Business Account. An Account Owner can see the list of members and pending invitations and easily add or remove members.

185.title: Settings
185.description: On the Settings page, you can change your business information. Please note this does not flow through to Farmlands. If you have a change of ownership, please contact Farmlands.

186.title: FAQs
186.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

187.title: Support
187.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

188.title: Farmlands POS Integration Guide
188.description: Farmlands has partnered with Centrapay to deliver new ways for your business to authorise and process Farmlands Card payments that are faster, easier, and more secure than ever.

189.title: Centrapay Integration Benefits
189.description: Integrating with Centrapay streamlines the process for authorising and invoicing Farmlands Card Payments. The integration provides:

190.title: Payment Flow Overview
190.description: Farmlands integrations use Centrapay’s Quick Pay Barcode Flow For Merchants to connect to Cardholders and accept Farmlands transactions.

191.title: Payment Flow Implementation
191.description: The Payment Flow can only be used by existing Farmlands Card Partners. Card Partners must complete the following steps to accept Farmlands transactions.

192.title: Merchant Configuration
192.description: Each Card Partner site that needs to accept Farmlands Card payments must be set up as a separate Centrapay Merchant with its own Merchant Config. The Merchant Config contains a Farmlands Payment Option that allows the site to accept Farmlands Payments.

193.title: Authentication
193.description: Requests to Centrapay’s APIs are authenticated by providing an API key in the X-Api-Key header. API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

194.title: Basic Requirements
194.description: The Payment Flow needs the following requirements to be met.

195.title: Payment Conditions
195.description: This extension enables the POS to enforce requiring an ID check for high-risk transactions.

196.title: Pre Auth
196.description: Farmlands Card Partners must support this extension when there is not an invoice number available at the point of sale or the purchase cannot be fulfilled immediately. This might happen if your stock is not on hand or you have a separate fulfilment process.

197.title: Cardholder Not Present
197.description: Farmlands Card Partners must support this extension if they accept payments when the Cardholder is not physically present when a payment is authorised. For example, to accept phone-based orders or orders where the Farmlands barcode is already known.

198.title: Validating Farmlands Barcodes
198.description: Farmlands Card Partners may optionally decode a scanned Farmlands Barcode to confirm that it is valid and apply Farmlands discounts before creating a Payment Request.

199.title: Handling Payment Errors
199.description: The POS must follow Centrapay’s guidelines on handling errors when dealing with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

200.title: Refunds
200.description: Cardholder purchases are refunded by refunding the Payment Request.

201.title: Short Codes
201.description: Payment Requests have a short code field that is human- and OCR-friendly. When combined with the date or merchant id, short codes can unambiguously identify the correct Payment Request.

202.title: Testing Your Integration
202.description: Merchant Integrators need to work with Farmlands and Centrapay to get set up to test payments. Please contact Farmlands to organise full end-to-end testing.

203.title: Certification Requirements
203.description: For Centrapay to allow integrations to have production assets turned on, we require partners to complete a Certification Process.

205.title: Initiating Refunds
205.description: How to issue refunds on the Centrapay payment platform.

206.title: Refund Idempotency
206.description: Refund requests must provide an externalRef that is unique for all refunds made against the Payment Request.

207.title: Obtaining a Payment Request Id
207.description: Refunds are initiated using the identifier for the Payment Request. However, a patron is NOT expected to have this information available.

208.title: By Short Code
208.description: Call the Get Payment Request by Short Code endpoint using the Centrapay short code that the patron obtains from their paper receipt or digital wallet transaction history.

209.title: By Transaction Reference
209.description: Lookup the transaction within the merchant system using the transaction reference that the patron obtains from their paper receipt or digital wallet transaction history.

210.title: Refund Error Handling
210.description: There are a number of reasons why refunds can fail. These are documented on the Refund Payment Request endpoint and should be communicated to the user.

211.title: Multi-Asset Selection
211.description: Payment Requests may be paid by multiple assets. When refunding a multi-asset Payment Request, the refunded asset is not controllable by the merchant.

212.title: Third-party Asset
212.description: Integrate your assets with Centrapay to unlock the potential to transact with terminals, point-of-sales and merchants already connected with the Centrapay Payments Network.

213.title: Defining a Payment Method
213.description: We require a way of identifying your asset in order to route payments to the correct asset provider. You must define a payment method namespace, description, and list of supported currencies.

214.title: Namespace
214.description: The namespace is a unique string to identify your asset. Your namespace must conform to the following properties:

215.title: Liveness
215.description: The liveness of a payment method can be either main or test. This can be used to accept test assets through Centrapay.

216.title: Description
216.description: Merchants may look at reports or receipts of past transactions. If there was a payment or refund with your asset against their Payment Request, the description of your asset will be displayed.

217.title: Supported Currencies
217.description: Payment Requests have a value determined by the currency a Merchant accepts. You should supply a finite list of three-letter ISO currency codes that is supported by your asset.

218.title: Example Definition
218.description:
| Field                                         | Type   | Description                                                         | Examples          |
| --------------------------------------------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| Namespace                       | String | A name used for uniquely identifying the asset as a payment method. | centrapay-example |
| Description                   | String | A short human readable description.                                 | Centrapay Money   |
| Supported Currencies | Array  | A list of supported currency codes.                                 | NZD, USD          |

219.title: Uplink API Requirements
219.description: To integrate with Centrapay payments, you must implement the Uplink endpoints. An Uplink is a strategy for performing payment or refund transactions for your Asset. These endpoints will be used in the lifecycle of a payment.

220.title: Contact Details
220.description: Centrapay requires at least one email address to notify you of integration failures or changes. You may choose to provide us with multiple emails for different priorities of communication.

221.title: Protocol
221.description: Each endpoint must use the HTTPS protocol.

222.title: URL
222.description: There are no restrictions regarding the provided URLs, so long as they adhere to the specification for the HTTP method, query parameters, request body, response body, and error codes.

223.title: Authentication
223.description: Endpoints are authenticated against requests using a JSON Web Token (JWT) issued by Centrapay. The JWT will be sent through the Authorization header in the HTTP Request.

224.title: Refund Endpoint
224.description: This endpoint is used to refund a Payment Request with status paid. Refunds must be synchronous i.e. the status must be successful or failed.

225.title: Cancel Endpoint
225.description: After initiating a transaction with the pay endpoint, the status may be pending. During this time something may have happened to prevent the payment request from being paid (e.g. payment request timeout or merchant network issues).

226.title: Get Transaction Endpoint
226.description: After initiating a payment transaction, the status may be pending. This endpoint will be used to poll the status of the transaction attempt. Polling will continue until either the transaction attempt status is successful or failed, or the Centrapay Payment Request is no longer payable (e.g. it has expired).

227.title: Implementation Checklist
227.description: To enable merchants to accept your asset as a payment method, you must complete an integration certification. When you're ready or need assistance/have questions integrating, please contact the Centrapay Engineering team at integrations@centrapay.com.

228.title: Line Items
228.description: Line items are used to communicate the details of a purchase to a patron.

229.title: Restrictions
229.description:
Payments via Centrapay can be made against specific line items. This can happen because a user has specifically requested the line items they wish an asset to pay for, or because they were using an asset that can only be redeemed for a specific product, like a Centrapay Token.
It's important to communicate to the merchant which line items have been purchased via Centrapay so they are able to make educated decisions when refunding transactions or completing partial payments.
This information should also be displayed to a consumer when possible. If any line items were purchased by a specific asset, they will be returned on a Payment Request inside the Asset Totals array.
Integrators must iterate through the assetTotals array and display any line items purchased to the merchant. Line items that have been purchased via Centrapay must no longer be able to be purchased using another form of payment.
This is especially important for any assets which are only redeemable against specific line items. For example, there could be a case where someone used a digital token to pay for a line item, and then a physical voucher to pay for that same line item, which would mean the second voucher could go towards purchasing something other than the intended line item.

230.title: Determining Paid For Line Items
230.description:
Payments via Centrapay can be made against specific line items. This can happen because a user has specifically requested the line items they wish an asset to pay for, or because they were using an asset that can only be redeemed for a specific product, like a Centrapay Token.
It's important to communicate to the merchant which line items have been purchased via Centrapay so they are able to make educated decisions when refunding transactions or completing partial payments.
This information should also be displayed to a consumer when possible. If any line items were purchased by a specific asset, they will be returned on a Payment Request inside the Asset Totals array.
Integrators must iterate through the assetTotals array and display any line items purchased to the merchant. Line items that have been purchased via Centrapay must no longer be able to be purchased using another form of payment.
This is especially important for any assets which are only redeemable against specific line items. For example, there could be a case where someone used a digital token to pay for a line item, and then a physical voucher to pay for that same line item, which would mean the second voucher could go towards purchasing something other than the intended line item.

231.title: Loading and Sending Assets
231.description: Issue and distribute Centrapay Assets such as Giftcards or Tokens to users via SMS.

232.title: Loading Giftcards
232.description: You can load Giftcards by calling our External Assets endpoint. You will need to use the giftcard number for the externalId field. The pin, the issuer and the type need to be on hand too.

233.title: Sending Assets
233.description: You can send Assets such as Tokens and Giftcards by calling our Asset Transfers endpoint. You will need to have the recipient’s phone number for recipientAlias to identify the reciever.

234.title: Example: Bulk distribution of Giftcards
234.description: Sometimes you might want to load and distribute Giftcards to a large number of recipients. This requires some scripting, but this is not hard. We can do this with:

235.title: Barcode Flow for Merchants
235.description: How merchants can accept payments by scanning a barcode presented by the patron.

236.title: Barcode Flow
236.description: The sequence diagram below indicates the expected flow of behavior between the patron, the Point of Sale (POS) and Centrapay.

237.title: Quick Pay Flow
237.description: Quick Pay is used to immediately confirm the payment without requiring patron approval.

238.title: Checking Barcode Details
238.description: The POS can optionally decode a scanned barcode in order to get further details about a barcode before it creates a Payment Request. For example, the POS can use the barcode provider to apply any provider-specific discounts before creating the Payment Request.

239.title: Merchant Integration Error Handling
239.description: How to deal with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

240.title: Respect Payment Status
240.description: Use the Payment Request status as the source of truth when determining if a Payment Request is paid or expired. For example, if cancelling a Payment Request fails with a REQUEST_PAID error then the terminal should respond accordingly; either by showing the transaction as paid or initiating a void instead.

241.title: Void Unknown Status
241.description: If the status of a transaction cannot be determined to be successful after retrying, then the Payment Request should be voided. Voiding a Payment Request will cancel the request and trigger any refunds if necessary.

242.title: Configure POS Timeout
242.description: Payment Requests have a configurable timeout which defaults to 2 minutes. Integrators should make sure that the payment terminal times out 5-10 seconds after the Payment Request.

243.title: Retry Unknown Errors
243.description: When faced with an unknown error while checking the status of a Payment Request, POS integrations should retry at least once before voiding the transaction.

244.title: Resolving Persistent Errors
244.description: For issues that cannot be resolved, please reach out to Centrapay Support at integrations@centrapay.com.

245.title: QR Code Flow for Merchants
245.description: How merchants can accept payments by presenting a QR code to the patron.

246.title: Partial Payment
246.description: A core feature of the Payment Request Protocol that allows integrators to accept a partial transaction through Centrapay.

247.title: Partial Payment Flow
247.description:
A patron asks the merchant to process a specified part of the total basket
amount using Centrapay. This could be due to the patron knowing their Centrapay
Asset balance wouldn’t cover the complete basket amount or enable them to use a
set amount of funds from a fixed value asset eg. Gift Card to complete the payment.
Related steps in diagram above: 1→2→3→4→5 or 2→3→4→5→6

248.title: Merchant Driven Scenario
248.description:
A patron asks the merchant to process a specified part of the total basket
amount using Centrapay. This could be due to the patron knowing their Centrapay
Asset balance wouldn’t cover the complete basket amount or enable them to use a
set amount of funds from a fixed value asset eg. Gift Card to complete the payment.
Related steps in diagram above: 1→2→3→4→5 or 2→3→4→5→6

249.title: Patron Driven Scenario
249.description:
A patron using a mobile wallet app may find they lack enough funds to cover the
full payment after connecting to a Centrapay Payment Request. Instead of the
cashier needing to cancel the Payment Request and start over, the patron can
make a partial payment with available funds. Once the Centrapay payment is
successful, the point of sale can take payment for the remaining amount using
another method.Related steps in diagram above: 2→3→4→5→6

250.title: Hybrid Partial Payment Scenario
250.description:
A combination of Merchant and App driven partial payments to cater for edge
cases where needed.Related steps in diagram above: 1→2→3→4→5→6

251.title: Implementation
251.description:
When creating a Payment Request,
opt into partial payment by:

252.title: Creating the Payment Request
252.description:
When creating a Payment Request,
opt into partial payment by:

253.title: Polling for Payment Confirmation
253.description:
Continue to poll the status of the Payment Request until it is no longer new.
If the Payment Request status has been updated to cancelled or expired,
proceed as you normally would. If the status is paid you need to check the
remainingAmount property on the Payment Request.

255.title: Patron Not Present
255.description: Centrapay’s Patron Not Present extension allows a merchant to complete a payment when the patron is not physically present at the time of payment.

256.title: Payment Conditions
256.description: Payment Conditions enable integrations to require conditional approval to accept specific Asset Types as payment.

257.title: Implementation
257.description: In order to support Payment Conditions, the merchant integration must extend Centrapay's payment protocol by creating the Payment Request with the conditionsEnabled flag set to true.

258.title: Additional Behaviors
258.description: The payment request status must always be polled after accepting or declining a condition as these actions may trigger the additional behaviors below.

259.title: Payment Flows
259.description: Centrapay facilitates secure and convenient transactions between customer and merchant devices, with multiple payment flows available for selection. Transact with ease and confidence using Centrapay.

260.title: Merchant-presented
260.description: When a merchant terminal has a customer-facing display it can prompt the customer to pay by showing a QR code.

261.title: Dynamic Merchant QR Code
261.description: When a merchant terminal is neither capable of displaying nor scanning QR codes or barcodes, such as for unattended vending machines, then a static QR code can be used.

262.title: Static Merchant QR Code
262.description: When a merchant terminal is neither capable of displaying nor scanning QR codes or barcodes, such as for unattended vending machines, then a static QR code can be used.

263.title: Patron-presented
263.description: When a merchant terminal is not capable of displaying a customer-facing QR code, then the payment request can be negotiated with the customer by scanning a barcode or QR code displayed on the customer’s smart device.

264.title: Dynamic Patron Barcode
264.description: This is a variant on Dynamic Patron Code. If you’ve setup a long lived Centrapay Enabled Barcode then you can use these to pay on behalf of a Customer. You may need to check a Customer’s Photo ID before this goes through.

265.title: Static Patron Barcode
265.description: This is a variant on Dynamic Patron Code. If you’ve setup a long lived Centrapay Enabled Barcode then you can use these to pay on behalf of a Customer. You may need to check a Customer’s Photo ID before this goes through.

266.title: Quick Pay
266.description: Quick Pay is used to pay the payment request after it is polled for the first time, without requiring patron approval. Quick Pay can only be triggered using the patron-presented flows, and the patron barcode must be linked to an asset type that allows quick pay.

267.title: Payment Terminal
267.description: How to integrate a payment terminal with Centrapay APIs.

268.title: API Keys
268.description: To create API keys, you first need to get in touch with Centrapay to be issued an Integrator Account and an “Account owner” API key. An “Account owner” is a special kind of role that allows you to manage your account.

269.title: Merchant Configs
269.description: Centrapay Merchant Configs represent an available set of configured payment methods that can be utilized by one or more payment terminals by a Merchant.

270.title: Example Flows
270.description: See Payment Flows for an overview of the API calls required for different payment flows.

271.title: Terminal Interface Guidelines
271.description: When configuring a terminal with Centrapay there are a few common touch points that require branded assets. Please use the Centrapay Brand Assets when building the UI for these screens.

272.title: Displaying a Button
272.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay button

273.title: Displaying an Icon
273.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay icon

274.title: Displaying QR Codes
274.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay QR code

275.title: Integration Architecture
275.description: We strongly recommend Centrapay APIs are invoked from your backend and not directly from your payment terminals. Centralizing the invocation of our APIs from your backend offers the following benefits:

276.title: Mitigating Network Issues
276.description: See the guide on Merchant Integration Error Handling for information on preventing and handling network issues.

277.title: Point of Sale
277.description: How to integrate a point of sale (POS) terminal with Centrapay APIs.

278.title: Core Requirements
278.description: Centrapay POS integrations must be able to create, void and refund Payment Requests on behalf of Merchants.

279.title: Optional Protocol Extensions
279.description: Our payment protocol supports several optional extensions. Please review the extensions below and determine which ones you need for your integration.

280.title: Contact Us
280.description: Contact integrations@centrapay.com to get started with API keys.

281.title: Requesting Payment
281.description: How to request payment on the Centrapay payment platform.

282.title: Connecting With Patrons
282.description: The Payment Request object is a core part of Centrapay’s payment protocol. It represents the intention of a merchant to receive payment, defines the amount to be paid, and the acceptable Asset Types for payment.

283.title: Required Fields
283.description: We require compliant integrations to provide the following optional fields when creating a Payment Request.

284.title: Short Codes
284.description: Payment Requests have a short code that is human- and OCR-friendly. Short codes are recycled every two years. When combined with the date or merchant id, short codes can unambiguously identify the correct Payment Request.

285.title: Polling for Payment Confirmation
285.description: After connecting with the patron, the POS must poll the Payment Request status every second until the status has changed.

286.title: Protocol Extensions
286.description: Our payment protocol supports several optional extensions. Please review the extensions below and determine which ones you need for your integration.

287.title: Handling Payment Errors
287.description: Merchant integrations should follow our guidelines in Merchant Integration Error Handling when inconsistencies such as network issues or race conditions occur.

288.title: Requesting Pre Auth
288.description: Centrapay’s Pre Auth extension allows a patron to authorize payment up to a limit when the actual payment amount is not yet known.

289.title: Restrictions
289.description: Pre Auth payments are not supported in all cases.

290.title: Pre Auth Flow
290.description: Pre Auth payments go through an orthogonal payment flow compared to Centrapay’s standard payment flow.

291.title: Authorize
291.description: An authorization is created when the Payment Request is created with the preAuth flag while Requesting Payment.

292.title: Confirm
292.description: Merchants can draw down on authorized funds by making one or more confirmations against an authorized amount. Confirmations must be made with an idempotencyKey in order to prevent merchants from drawing down on authorized funds twice.

293.title: Release
293.description: Authorized funds that have not been confirmed can optionally be released so that the asset holder is granted access to their remaining funds without needing to wait for the authorization to expire.

294.title: Expiry
294.description: Authorizations automatically expire after 3 months. Any unreleased funds are subsequently released to the Patron.

295.title: Refund
295.description: Refunds can be made against authorizations, confirmations, released authorizations and expired authorizations.

296.title: Void
296.description: Voiding a Payment Request will cancel a Payment Request and trigger any refunds necessary. This operation is useful if the POS needs to back out of a transaction due to a network error for example. Voiding can only be used up to 24 hours after the Payment Request was created.

297.title: Paying a Payment Request
297.description: Integrate your app with Centrapay to pay payment requests on merchant terminals and POS

298.title: Overview
298.description:
This guide is for a Third-party Asset Provider to enable paying with their
digital assets with Centrapay.

299.title: Authenticating API calls on behalf of users
299.description:
Third-party applications can make API calls on behalf of users with Centrapay
API keys. All API requests to Centrapay must be made from the integrator’s server.
Centrapay API keys must also be managed server side and stored as secrets to
minimize the risk of API keys being compromised.

300.title: Payment Flow Overview
300.description:
The payment flow below describes how a Third-party Asset Provider should integrate
with the Dynamic Merchant QR Code flow to enable digital payments within their
application. Below is an overview of the process, followed by a more in-depth
look at the integrator’s responsibilities.

301.title: Payment Flow Implementation
301.description:
The user will then scan the QR code from inside the app. Valid Centrapay QR Codes
will have the format https://app.centrapay.com/pay/{paymentRequestId}. Validate
the url by asserting it matches the above format and ignore any malformed QR codes.

302.title: Scan Centrapay QR code
302.description:
The user will then scan the QR code from inside the app. Valid Centrapay QR Codes
will have the format https://app.centrapay.com/pay/{paymentRequestId}. Validate
the url by asserting it matches the above format and ignore any malformed QR codes.

303.title: Get the Payment Request
303.description:
Once the app has validated the url, use the id of the Payment Request to
call the Get Payment Request
API from your server. The returned PaymentRequest model
will provide the details needed to determine if the Payment Request can be completed.

304.title: Pay the Payment Request
304.description:
If the Payment Request is payable with your Asset then you should display the
Payment Request details to the user. Some relevant fields to display are:

305.title: Payment Extensions
305.description:
Extensions to the payment protocol can be used to enhance the user's experience
by providing alternative payment flows.

306.title: Partial Pay
306.description:
If both your app and the merchant support Partial Pay
then you may allow the user to pay only a portion of the Payment Request and
then pay the remaining amount with an alternative payment method.

307.title: Testing
307.description:
Centrapay supports test resources that can be used for integration testing. A test
merchant will be provided that accepts test payments. If you have supplied a
test third-party asset then this merchant can be configured to accept it as a
payment method.

308.title: Transaction Reporting
308.description: Guidelines on communicating the Asset Types used for payment to the user in any transaction reporting function on the merchant side.
